intro: Crepis insularis, commonly known as the island hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It is a member of the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its low-growing, herbaceous structure. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in dense clusters, which are typical of the daisy family. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in fine hairs, adapting to the arid conditions of its native habitat. Crepis insularis is often found in rocky or sandy soils, thriving in coastal and inland environments.
